contents.item: No sympathy for the devil; keep that in mind. Buy the ticket, take the ride...and if it occasionally gets a little heavier than what you had in mind, well...maybe chalk it up to forced consciousness expansion: Tune in, freak out, get beaten.
contents.owner: Hunter S. Thompson, Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas

contents.item: There’s no such thing as ruining your life. Life’s a pretty resilient thing, it turns out.
Let me be, was all I wanted. Be what I am, no matter how I am.
contents.owner: Henry Miller, Stand Still Like the Hummingbird

contents.item: The thing about getting older is that you don't need everything to be possible any more, you just need things to be certain.
Sometimes you have to kind of die inside in order to rise from your own ashes and believe in yourself and love yourself to become a new person.
I can choose either to be a victim of the world or an adventurer in search of treasure. It's all a question of how I view my life.
There is not a particle of life which does not bear poetry within it
Unexpected intrusions of beauty. This is what life is.
A pain stabbed my heart, as it did every time I saw a girl I loved who was going the opposite direction in this too-big world.
I think prime numbers are like life. They are very logical but you could never work out the rules, even if you spent all your time thinking about them
contents.owner: Mark Haddon, The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time

contents.item: Do I dare Disturb the universe? In a minute there is time For decisions and revisions which a minute will reverse.
Do not despise your own place and hour. Every place is under the stars, every place is the center of the world.
contents.owner: John Burroughs, Studies in Nature and Literature

contents.item: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
But how could you live and have no story to tell?
This must be Thursday,' said Arthur to himself, sinking low over his beer. 'I never could get the hang of Thursdays.
contents.owner: Douglas Adams, The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

contents.item: She burned too bright for this world.

I don’t live in either my past or my future. I’m interested only in the present. If you can concentrate always on the present, you’ll be a happy man. Life will be a party for you, a grand festival, because life is the moment we’re living now.
Develop an interest in life as you see it; the people, things, literature, music - the world is so rich, simply throbbing with rich treasures, beautiful souls and interesting people. Forget yourself.
It's not the men in your life that matters, it's the life in your men.
Every luxury must be paid for, and everything is a luxury, starting with being in this world.
contents.owner: Cesare Pavese, Il mestiere di vivere: Diario 1935-1950
